input.code:
### Notation

- Scalars: lower-case letters \\(v,m\\)
- Vectors: boldface lower-case letters \\(\mathbf{v}\\)
- Matrices: boldface capital letters \\(\mathbf{M}\\)

TODO: staged?

- \\(i\\)th element of a vector \\(\mathbf{v}\\): \\(v_i\\)
- \\((i,j)\\)-element of a matrix \\(\mathbf{M}\\): \\(M_{ij}\\)
- \\(i\\)th row of a matrix \\(\mathbf{M}\\): \\(\mathbf{M}_{i:}\\)
- \\(j\\)th column of a matrix \\(\mathbf{M}\\): \\(\mathbf{M}_{:j}\\)
input.outputFormat:
Notation

  • Scalars: lower-case letters v,m
  • Vectors: boldface lower-case letters v
  • Matrices: boldface capital letters M

TODO: staged?

  • ith element of a vector v: vi
  • (i,j)-element of a matrix M: Mij
  • ith row of a matrix M: Mi:
  • jth column of a matrix M: M:j

input.code:
### Matrix Operations
- the **inner product** (also called *dot product*) is \\( < \mathbf{u}, \mathbf{v} > := \sum_{\ell=1}^L u_\ell v_\ell\\) 
 where \\(\mathbf{u}\in\Re^L\\) and \\(\mathbf{v}\in\Re^L\\)
- the **outer product**  \\( \mathbf{u} \circ \mathbf{v} \\) between vectors \\(\mathbf{u}\in\Re^n\\) and \\(\mathbf{v}\in\Re^m\\) is the \\(n\times m\\) matrix with elements \\(u_iv_j\\), \\( i=\{1,\cdots,n\} \\) and \\(j= \{1,\cdots,n\} \\).
- For matrices \\(\mathbf{U} \in\Re^{n\times L} \\) and \\(\mathbf{V} \in \Re^{m \times L} \\), \\( \mathbf{U} \circ \mathbf{V} := \sum_{\ell=1}^L \mathbf{U}_{:\ell} \circ \mathbf{V}_{:,\ell} = \mathbf{U}\mathbf{V}^T\\) 
 - When \\(\mathbf{M} = \mathbf{U} \circ \mathbf{V} \\) with *L<min(m,n)*, we call the pair \\( (\mathbf{U} , \mathbf{V} ) \\) a *low-rank factorization* of \\(\mathbf{M}\\)
input.outputFormat:
Matrix Operations

  • the inner product (also called dot product) is <u,v>:=∑Lℓ=1uℓvℓ where u∈ℜL and v∈ℜL
  • the outer product u∘v between vectors u∈ℜn and v∈ℜm is the n×m matrix with elements uivj, i=1,⋯,n and j=1,⋯,n.
  • For matrices U∈ℜn×L and V∈ℜm×L, U∘V:=∑Lℓ=1U:ℓ∘V:,ℓ=UVT
  • When M=U∘V with L<min(m,n), we call the pair (U,V) a low-rank factorization of M

input.code:
### References I

- Kolda, Tamara G., and Brett W. Bader. "Tensor decompositions and applications." SIAM review 51.3 (2009): 455-500.
- Goldberg, Andrew B., Zhu, Xiaojin, Recht, Benjamin, Xu, Jun-Ming, Nowak, Robert. "Transduction with Matrix Completion: Three Birds with One Stone." In Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems (NIPS) 24. 2010. 

Are we going to have these after every section? I was thinking of having another "chapter" in the end, where we annotate them.

  • Goldberg, Andrew B., Zhu, Xiaojin, Recht, Benjamin, Xu, Jun-Ming, Nowak, Robert. "Transduction with Matrix Completion: Three Birds with One Stone." In Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems (NIPS) 24. 2010.
